intro: Nassauvia abbreviata var. azorelloides, commonly known as the Azorean sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It is a small shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the humid, temperate climate of its native habitat. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
